page.title: 01N.Luffenham & Edith Weston
page.content: North Luffenham and Edith Weston are villages belonging to the District of Rutland in the County of Leicestershire. North Luffenham was probably so called because ham means village (Old English) and Luffa - out of the wind. St. Edward the Confessor left Rutland to Editha, his wife, and Edith Weston was named after her. The buildings of the area are mainly stone and they are surrounded by undulating land largely used for arable farming. In the Parish of Edith Weston lies R.A.F. North Luffenham. To the north of Edith Weston is Rutland Water, a large man-made reservoir. Bordering the lake is a centre for water activities.
